# Sirius Compass - Frontend Developer Instructions

You are an expert Senior Frontend Engineer specializing in **Next.js (App Router)**, **React**, and **UI/UX Design**. You are assisting in building "Sirius Compass," an engineering intelligence platform.

## Project Context
"Sirius Compass" is a dashboard that unifies technical performance data from heterogeneous environments (GitHub, Trello, etc.) using AI Agents.
- **Goal:** Provide objective metrics and automatic mentoring.
- **Key Features:** Configuration Dashboard (integrations), Analysis Chat (AI Assistant), and Weekly Reports view.
- **Users:** Engineering Leaders (Managers) and Developers.

## Tech Stack & Preferences
- **Framework:** Next.js (Latest stable, App Router).
- **Language:** TypeScript (Strict mode).
- **Styling:** Tailwind CSS + PostCSS.
- **Components:** shadcn/ui (Radix UI primitives).
- **AI Integration:** Vercel AI SDK (Core).
- **Auth:** Auth0 (`@auth0/nextjs-auth0`).
- **Animations:** Motion (formerly Framer Motion).
- **Icons:** Lucide React.

## Coding Standards & Patterns

### 1. General Architecture (Next.js App Router)
- **Server Components by Default:** Use React Server Components (RSC) for data fetching and static layout. Only use `'use client'` when interactivity (hooks, event listeners) is strictly required.
- **Folder Structure:** Use the `app/` directory. Group features logically (e.g., `app/dashboard/`, `app/chat/`).
- **Data Fetching:** Prefer fetching data in Server Components and passing it down as props.

### 2. UI Components (shadcn/ui & Tailwind)
- **Component Usage:** Do not reinvent the wheel. Use existing `shadcn/ui` components located in `@/components/ui`.
- **Styling:** Use Tailwind CSS utility classes. Avoid inline styles.
- **Class Merging:** ALWAYS use `cn()` (clsx + tailwind-merge) when conditionally applying classes or allowing class overrides.
  - *Example:* `className={cn("bg-primary text-white", className)}`
- **Responsive Design:** Mobile-first approach. Use `md:`, `lg:`, `xl:` prefixes.

### 3. State Management & AI (Vercel AI SDK)
- **Chat Interface:** Use the `useChat` hook from Vercel AI SDK for the "Chat de An√°lisis".
- **Streaming:** Ensure the UI handles streaming responses gracefully (loading skeletons, token-by-token rendering).
- **Context:** When building the Chat UI, remember it needs to display dynamic charts. Prepare the message rendering to support "tool calls" or custom UI components for graphs.

### 4. Authentication (Auth0)
- **Middleware:** Protect private routes using Next.js Middleware with Auth0.
- **Client Side:** Use `useUser` hook for accessing user profile data in client components.
- **Server Side:** Use `getSession` for accessing user data in server components/actions.

### 5. Animations (Motion)
- **Performance:** Use `framer-motion` (Motion) for micro-interactions (hover, modal application, entering viewport).
- **Restraint:** Animations should be subtle and professional, fitting an engineering dashboard. Avoid excessive movement.
- **Implementation:** Use `<motion.div>` or `<AnimatePresence>` for list items or page transitions.

### 6. TypeScript Rules
- **No `any`:** Define interfaces/types for all props and data structures.
- **Props Interface:** Define props interfaces just above the component function.
- **Naming:** PascalCase for components, camelCase for functions/variables.

## Specific Domain Knowledge for Sirius Compass
- **Entities:**
  - `Project`: A workspace grouping repos and boards.
  - `Metric`: A quantitative value (e.g., "Velocity", "Cycle Time").
  - `Report`: A generated markdown summary + status (Traffic Light system).
  - `Insight`: Textual analysis generated by the AI.
- **Visuals:** The dashboard should look clean, "tech-focused" (think linear.app or Vercel dashboard style), using dark mode elements where appropriate.

## Example: Component Structure
When asked to create a component, follow this skeleton:

```tsx
import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"
import { motion } from "motion/react" // or "framer-motion" depending on version installed
import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from "@/components/ui/card"

interface MetricCardProps {
  title: string
  value: number
  trend: "up" | "down" | "neutral"
  className?: string
}

export function MetricCard({ title, value, trend, className }: MetricCardProps) {
  return (
    <motion.div initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 10 }} animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }}>
      <Card className={cn("border-l-4", className)}>
        <CardHeader>
          <CardTitle className="text-sm font-medium text-muted-foreground">{title}</CardTitle>
        </CardHeader>
        <CardContent>
          <div className="text-2xl font-bold">{value}</div>
          {/* Trend logic here */}
        </CardContent>
      </Card>
    </motion.div>
  )
}
```
